boardgame.name: Let Sleeping Dons Lie
boardgame.description:
In Let Sleeping Dons Lie your goal is to get out of your criminal life with enough loot for a fresh start before the Don wakes up.

As a member of the Don’s crime family, you begin with a hand of 7 cards and some loot. The Don is laid out sleeping in the middle of the play area. Based on how big your crime family is, will determine how much plunder there is to go around.

Each turn you draw a card from either the draw or discard piles.
Then Play a card onto the discard pile, following any actions that may be on the card. When you manage to pick up a total of 7 of one type of plunder, the round ends and the plunder is stashed into Loot bags. Then another round starts. You escape when you are the first to reach enough loot bags for a fresh start.

If the Don wakes up then the game is over and you have to get out with what you loot you can carry.

boardgame.name: Karrier
boardgame.description:
Karrier is a board game where 3-6 players compete. You need to clean up your dedicated area and reach the sacred altar to win. Get rid of all the trash in your land. Beware, some players can be sneaky. Secretly dump trash in other areas or throw it to opponents’ karriers! Blow others’ Karriers up! Form your own strategy and be the first to take all the honor and reward!

On their turn, players draw and play cards, load trash and move around the board.

The game ends when a player has achieved the goal or when the draw deck runs out of action cards.

The first player to clear the Trash token of their own territory and enter the Sacred Altar with an empty Karrier claims Victory.

boardgame.name: Cocktails & Appetizers dice game
boardgame.description:
A push your luck dice game of making real Cocktail and Appetizer recipes with cards of real recipes of cocktails and appetizers.

Take 3 random cards, roll the dice to try and roll the "Plate" or "Glass" to start your recipe card then start finding the ingredients you need to finish the recipe card, if you finish a card you can keep the points on the card or you can re-roll the unused dice, but if you don't roll an ingredient you can use you lose all the dice you've collected and no score collected and play passes to the next player.

Play continues until one a player reaches a score of 20.

boardgame.name: Draughts
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Play checkers against your TRS-80. Two startup options are available - choose whether you or the computer moves first, and how may moves the computer is allowed to look ahead (3-8). The board and pieces are displayed with graphics and chess notation is used to enter your moves.

boardgame.name: Little Tokyo
boardgame.description:
You've never seen a stacking game with charm like this! Filled with chunky wooden charms featuring the joys of Tokyo, this stacking game challenges players to build two wobbly towers at the same time. Choosing which piece to place next is critical as it may leave your opponent with some of the hardest (and heaviest) pieces for the top of the stack.

In addition to two unique modes of play, you may enjoy keeping these charms as decorations in between games.

Goal of the Game:
Players gradually stack wooden figures with Japanese motifs onto the two "Little Tokyo" Skyline base pieces. If any piece falls or if one of the tower collapses, the player that caused the fall loses a point. The game ends when all pieces have been stacked OR someone has collected three negative points.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 6 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 6+
LITTLE TOKYO STAPELSPIEL Den Namen Little Tokyo übersetzen wir mal ganz frei: „Mit-ruhiger-Hand-dem-Gegner-einen-reinwürgen-damit-ihm-die-Minuspunkte-nur-so-um-die-Ohren-fliegen.“
Die Winkekatze Maneki-neko, der wütende Kaiju, der fette Arsch vom Sumoringer – stapele sie alle zu einem aberwitzigen Turm. Und sieh zu, dass deine Freunde nicht wissen, wie sie ihre Alna-Sharyo-Straßenbahn noch unterbringen. Oder einen anderen Klotz, den sie gerade am Bein haben. Das Ganze geht immer schön der Reihe nach! Entscheidend ist, dass dein Zeug oben bleibt und die anderen mit ungeschickten Fingern den Turm aus seinem Gleichgewicht bringen.
Little Tokyo ist der Auftakt einer neuen Serie von Heldbergs-Spielen. Die Regeln sind simpel. Und wenn niemand Zeit für ein Match hat? Dann spielst du für dich. Oder du dekorierst deine Wohnung mit den kultigen Figuren.
Die Figuren sind nicht nur Spielfiguren, sondern auch Figuren zum Spielen. Das bedeutet du kannst damit auch einfach nur spielen, oder sammeln…
Inhalt: 30 schön illustrierte und beidseitig bedruckte Stapelfiguren Spielanleitung (Deutsch und Englisch) 3 Sticker 1 handsignierte Postkarte
Besonderheiten: Limitiert auf 450 Spiele, händisch durchnummeriert 3 exklusive Japansticker und eine von den Autoren handsignierte Karte Detailverliebt und aufwändig produzierte Spielfiguren aus massiver Buche, beidseitig bedruckt und exklusiv für uns hergestellt beim Traditionshersteller HABA in Oberfranken. Spielekarton per Hand siebgedruckt vom coolen Typen Sascha Verpackung aus 100% biologisch abbaubaren Karton Für den Druck auf Spielfiguren und Karton werden nur umweltfreundliche und wasserbasierte Farben ohne Chemie verwendet. Made in Germany / Hergestellt in Deutschland
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN

boardgame.name: Nur noch 4 Plätze!
boardgame.description:
The players form two teams and take turns to roll and move. Each team controls four pawns. They start at home at space 1 and have to reach the train station at space 35. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The first team to get four pawns to the train station wins the game.

The game was published just after WWII. It came in an envelope and the meeples consisted of small aluminium cylinders, perhaps leftovers from other productions.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mission: Bathroom Run
boardgame.description:
You’re snuggled up warm and drowsy in your bed when it strikes: the need to use the bathroom. If you try to just clench down and ignore it, you could ruin your comfy cozy bed and have to wake up your parents. So you decide to navigate your way past spooky shadows and scary noises to relieve your need so you can get back to bed and finally fall to sleep.

Mission: Bathroom Run is a game for 2 or more players. The only thing required is 1 six-sided die per player and 1 deck of playing cards for every 2 players. Draw a card, roll a die, and see if you make it to the bathroom!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Miau-Mäh-Muh!
boardgame.description:
On each of 36 cards are 2 to 6 different animals. The cards are laid out face down. The player whose turn it is rolls the dice and tries to uncover a card with the animal on it. If the player succeeds, he may collect the cards that have been revealed so far, or continue rolling the dice and reveal another card. If the player does not succeed, all revealed cards must be turned over again and it is the next player's turn. The player who collects the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: -80 Space Raiders
boardgame.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Star Trek franchise.




Publisher Description

-80 Space Raiders is the most comprehensive, realistic space combat simulation available for the TRS-80 microcomputer. The Space Raiders simulation places you inside the United Federation of Planet's Starship Defiant, from which you can look out into space and see the stars of the Galaxy as you fly past at many times the speed of light. You'll experience realistic sensations of space travel as you see thousands of stars appearing in the distance ahead of you wan then parting before you as you flash past.

Space Raiders goes beyond the scope of simple computer games: you should not expect to fully understand the details of the simulation without spending several days in the serious study of this manual. As you study, you'll learn more than the rules of the game. You'll learn about celestial navigation, energy management, tactical and strategic combat maneuvers, and how to control a severely damaged starship.

This manual also contains information regarding the three main tasks which await your completion during each mission: finding the enemy convoy, destroying each enemy ship in combat, and returning to your home starbase.

The Federation is Counting on you. Good Luck!

boardgame.name: Colt Express: Silk Bandit
boardgame.description:
Silk, the new Colt Express bandit…
… For whom you can choose or make up your own power!*

You can choose one of the three following special powers:

Move power: Move 1 or 2 Cars, whether you are inside the train or on the roof.
Dodge power: Give to the player of your choice the Neutral Bullet you get when you encounter a Lawman (Marshal or Shotgun) and then change positions as specified in the rulebook.
Block power: You block the rear door entrance. No other Character (Bandit or Marshal) can enter that Car through the rear door.


All players must agree on the power of Silk before choosing their Bandit.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mercenary Commander
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

The year is 1863. Mexico. You are a soldier of Maximillian (sic), the Mexican king. It is your duty to keep the area under French rule. You must put down revolts and keep the peasants under control. You have 7 men and 12 villages to protect. To win you must control all twelve villages and have at least one soldier left. If your last soldier is killed you lose. But you must end the rebellion in every village!

User Summary

A grim variation of the game system used in Jedi Knight: Warriors of the Old Republic, a 1981 release from Computer Simulations Company. In Jedi Knight you were fighting against Darth Vader. Here you command a group of soldiers who are terrorizing a peasant population in order to put down a rebellion. The light saber battle sequences from Jedi Knight are morphed into duels with swords.

boardgame.name: Lunar Encounter
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

Commander, this message is to notify you that there is an evil creature raining havoc on all our explorer posts and work sites. There's a chance it is alien so be careful. We have no idea of its real powers yet, but we are gathering a report now. We will keep you posted. Take sled, laser and a full 3 days of supply.

User Summary

A variation of the game system used in The Dark Kingdom, a 1981 release from Computer Simulations Company. The Medieval fantasy theme has been changed to a science-fiction one.

boardgame.name: Funkstille
boardgame.description:
The players set up their satellite dishes between the two planets with the spikes pointing at the double lines on their respective spaces. Then the players take turns rolling a die and rotating one of their dishes according to he result of the roll.
The first player to get to align the spikes in a straight line between the planets wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Valhalla Lemmings
boardgame.description:
In legendary Svervegia, clans of Lemmings clash to gain access to Valhalla! Clash with the other Lemmings but try to get out ... defeated! Only the defeated have access to Valhalla! The winners will return to their village and attract the attention of a local Legend.

Will you be able to lose the battles and send all your Lemmings to Valhalla?

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Zinga
boardgame.description:
Roll the dice, hit the bell and name the correct combination of color and number. You cross off the combination on your score sheet. The first person to complete 5 combinations in a row and say “ZINGA!” wins. To win you have to react as quickly as possible. But be careful! After 3 mistakes you are out of the game. And you make mistakes quickly, because even doubting for too long counts as a mistake!

—description from the publsiher

boardgame.name: Beyond Their Grasping Master
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Journey to the town of Thornbrook where a hole has mysteriously appeared for no obvious reason and the townspeople want it gone. Each has their own tales of items disappearing whenever that hole has been present. After a few stout and foolhardy folks made their way into it and never came back, nobody local is willing to venture within. If the heroes expect to be able to leave Thornbrook, it seems the only way they can go is down.

Beyond their Grasping Master was not made for any specific ttrpg system, but is suitable for pretty much any Fantasy setting and ruleset.

boardgame.name: Untamed: Feral Factions – Spirit Strike expansion
boardgame.description:
The first expansion to the fast-paced shuffle-building card battle game Untamed Feral Factions,the Spirit Strike expansion adds the Snakes, Gorillas and Deer into the mix, adding new keywords and abilities, and enabling powerful new combos!

Moreover, the Squirrel and Platypus factions are also available to add even MORE variety to your Untamed Feral Factions game!

Content also available in Upgrade KIT: The Upgrade Kit includes the 3 new factions, plus all Spirit Strike Edition content: premium tokens, premium Quick Setup (vac)Tray, and all applicable Stretch Goals and Exclusives.

The original game is needed to to use the expansion or upgrade kit.

boardgame.name: Uluk
boardgame.description:
Elders say that our world is a fruit of the sacred uluk tree. No humans have ever stepped on this magical land, and you are the leaders of its hunter-gatherer tribes of sentient animals, collecting food, developing inventions, and erecting monuments in honor of the ancient gods to fulfill their spiritual needs. The winner in this competition will ensure happiness and well-being for their tribe members, and he or she will be praised as the arch leader of all the tribes!

The goal of the game is to have the most Happiness Points at the end of the sixth round (season). There are several different ways to score points, but the most important activity in the game is to send your tribe members (called here "tribers") to various spaces on the main board and take actions corresponding to them.

Uluk mostly makes use of the classic worker placement mechanics. The players send their tribers to spaces on the main board to build monuments and gather raw resources. The resources gathered are stored on each player's tribe board and may then be processed into food. Feeding your tribers brings you HPs and lets you win the game after the sixth season. A single season is divided into six phases in which the players take their actions in a clockwise order:

Errand phase - place your tribers on the main board
Harvest phase - gather resources from the main board
Processing phase - process raw resources from your tribe board into food
Feeding phase - spend food on feeding your tribers
Ecology phase - adjust the harvest levels (quantity of resources available) on the main board
Clean-up phase - build monuments and prepare for the next season

Developing inventions (in the form of invention cards with different symbols) enhances the effectiveness of your food processing, and collecting sets of different symbols brings extra points at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Monkey Murder Manor
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Within the Manor is the Pit, a hole in reality that spews out hordes of otherworldly monkeys. The Manor has done its job and killed them, over and over again, for decades upon decades. As the woods darkened and the blood was spilled and the Manor was forgotten, something changed. It grew bitter and hateful, and now the seal has been broken.

boardgame.name: Fletter Fuse
boardgame.description:
Super-Charge your Word Building But avoid the Fletter Fuse bombs!

In Fletter Fuse, 2-6 players have to fuse Single, Double and Triple letters together to make words. Everyone plays at the same time, so you have to think fast and act faster than your opponents if you want to win. The aim of the game is to make the most points.

Players toss cards with letters into a joint pool. The first player to see a word of 5 letter or more, shouts the word out and collects the cards. Once the deck runs out, the cards are added up and the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: 15 Giochi con Piero
Quindici Giochi con Piero
boardgame.description:
A book of 15 small games, some including boards, that were published in remembrance of game designer Piero Cioni.

"In June 2019, a great friend and colleague, Piero Cioni, left us prematurely, and many Italian authors wanted to create this work that, in addition to remembering and paying homage to him, wants to make a small contribution to the organization that has supported him in his latest days and which offers daily assistance to cancer patients and their families: the ANT Foundation.

“In this volume you will find Fifteen Games with Piero. Many times we have found ourselves around a table with Piero, exchanging ideas with him, and we would like to do it again. But Piero is no longer there and so we turned to his games, to the ones we loved most, "talking" with them to create new ones. They are therefore not Piero's games but they are, perhaps, the games that we could have designed together.".


“Nel Giugno del 2019 ci ha prematuramente lasciati un grande amico e collega, Piero Cioni, e molti autori italiani hanno voluto realizzare questa opera che, oltre a ricordarlo ed omaggiarlo, vuole dare un piccolo contributo all’organizzazione che lo ha supportato nei suoi ultimi giorni e che quotidianamente offre assistenza ai malati di tumore e alle loro famiglie: la Fondazione ANT,” scrivono nella prefazione i promotori dell’iniziativa.“In questo volume troverete Quindici Giochi con Piero. Tante volte ci siamo trovati intorno a un tavolo con Piero, a scambiarci idee con lui, e vorremmo farlo ancora. Ma Piero non c’è più e allora ci siamo rivolti ai suoi giochi, a quelli che abbiamo più amato, “parlando” con loro per crearne di nuovi. Non sono quindi giochi “di” Piero ma sono, forse, i giochi che avremmo potuto progettare insieme” concludono.

boardgame.name: Chibi Army of Doom
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time there was a country where justice reigned, there was no poverty and power was actually in the hands of a capable person. That land was Syntharia, which was ruled by King Rorik. After he died, the country sank into Chaos and a new king have to be found. So the people started a tournament for the best, strongest and wisest people of Syntharia, this tournament is called Chibi Army of Doom.

Chibi Army of Doom is a game in which you can choose one of ten different characters and then have to eliminate all other players in a battle royale tournament. Each character has its own deck consisting of 30 cards and thus individual skills. Tthere are a variety of skills that can be used on opposing turns to protect yourself or to prevent other players from their actions.

Each player chooses a character. Then all player places up to 5 Obstacles from the box on the Table.

Each player takes in turn and resolves all turn effects, draws cards, and takes actions and calculate damage. Each character has 20 life points and is kicked out of the game when it reaches 0. The winner is the last player standing.

boardgame.name: Name Dropping
boardgame.description:
Name Dropping is the frustratingly fun movie card game. Challenge your friends and family to hours of fast paced fun as you listen to clues to guess the titles of Hollywood's biggest films. Comes with over 300 movie trivia cards, featuring blockbusters, indie films, superhero movies, cult classics, musicals, and much more.

Each Name Dropping card comes with 6 clues, ranked hardest to easiest, that relate to a particular movie, clues include actors/actresses, a quote, and a fun trivia fact, to help you figure out the movie name. Each card also comes with a clue genre, which gives you a snapshot description of the movie, to help guide your guessing.

One team-mate reads the clues, while the rest try to guess the answer as quickly as possible. If the team guesses correctly, they keep the card and add points.

boardgame.name: The Movie Movie Game
boardgame.description:
Movie Movie Game is a brand-new board game for every entertainment lover brought to you by The Valleyfolk, the creators of the popular Movie Movie Game series on YouTube.

In Movie Movie Game, you and your friends test your knowledge of popular movie titles in the stupidest way possible. Movie Movie Game forces its players to bend and twist their brains in ways hitherto unseen by modern humankind. Anyone can name a movie based on a loose outline of its plot, but Movie Movie Game combines titles in such a way that you'll be dying laughing as your friend struggles to find the right way to say "Saving Private RyAnnihilation." Pro-tip: The trick is to really let them squirm.

The basic rules are for individuals or teams to try to guess the film with the first person making it to 20 points winning. Variant rules are provided. The end of the game is decided before the game begins.

boardgame.name: The Wicked Labyrinth
ウィキッド・ラビリンス
boardgame.description:
ウィキッド・ラビリンス (The Wicked Labyrinth) is a bluffing card game from Japan, produced by the makers of The Wicked Forest and features the distinctive illustration of anime artist Gekidan Inu Curry (劇団イヌカレー).

The publisher says:
You are one of the young men participating in a ritual and you enter a labyrinth inhabited by a witch with a bull's head. In order to escape, you must explore the labyrinth's "corridors" and collect the "soul fragments" of those who have entered the labyrinth in the past. However, depending on the "corridors" you explore, you may have to take in the "witch's stain" which is a negative point. You will have to explore many corridors to collect more soul shards than anyone else and escape the labyrinth.

Each year, only a select few are allowed to return from the ritual.
The chosen young people who have just come of age enter the labyrinth. The labyrinth is said to be inhabited by a witch with the head of a cow. Those who return are honoured as heroes. And the next day, some of those who had disappeared in the labyrinth would return. All of them have the gift of heroism and will later achieve some success.

The game features
Explore the corridors of the labyrinth and collect the "soul fragments"! Only the player who has more search pieces than anyone else can search.

However, only the player who holds more search pieces than anyone else will be able to search, and in addition to the search pieces, he can also hold the "sign of the witch", which is a negative point. If it is held by another player, the searching player must take back the negative witch's stain.

The value of the soul can be increased by collecting soul pieces of the same colour and leveling them up. So collect as many points as you can and win!

Game Overview
The player becomes one of the young people who participate in the ritual and explores the "labyrinth" where the witch with the head of a cow is said to live. In this game, you have to explore the labyrinth one corridor at a time to collect the soul shard tokens. In order to do so, the player has to reveal more pieces than anyone else in order to be entitled to explore the corridors. (The player who reveals the second most pieces also gets the right to explore.) However, depending on the corridor explored, the player may have to take a negative point, the "Witch's Stain". You will have to explore many corridors and collect soul shards tokens while avoiding them. With the collected soul fragment tokens, you can achieve the "oracle card" and get more points to escape the "labyrinth"!

あなたは儀式へ参加する若者の一人となって、牛の頭を持つ魔女が棲むという迷宮に入ります。脱出する為には迷宮の中にある「回廊」を探索して、過去に迷宮に入った者の『魂の欠片』を集めます。しかし、探索した「回廊」によってはマイナス点である「魔女の穢れ」を引き取る必要があります。それらを避けながら沢山の「回廊」を探索して誰よりも多くの『魂の欠片』を集め迷宮を脱出しましょう。

その儀式から帰還できる者は、毎年決まってヒトリだけ。
成人を迎えたばかりの選ばれし若者が迷宮へと入っていく。 その迷宮は牛の頭を持つ魔女が棲むという曰く付きのものである。 帰還した者は英雄として称えられる。 そして、翌日にはその迷宮で過去に消えた者も数名戻っている事があった。 それらはいずれも英雄としての才能を持ち、後に何らかの成功を収める事となる。

【ゲームの特徴】
・迷宮にある回廊を探索して、『魂の欠片』を集めよう！ただし、探索ができるのはだれよりも多く探索駒を握ったプレイヤーだけ。

・探索駒の他に、マイナス点である『魔女の気配』も一緒に握る事ができる。それが他のプレイヤーによって握られていたなら、探索を行うプレイヤーはマイナス点である魔女の穢れを引き取る必要がある。

・同色の『魂の欠片』を集めてレベルアップすることで魂の価値を上げる事ができる。そうして得点をたくさん集め、勝利せよ！

【ゲームの概要】
プレイヤーは儀式に参加する若者の一人となり、牛の頭を持つ魔女が棲むという「迷宮」を探索します。 このゲームでは「迷宮」にある「回廊」を１つずつ探索して『魂の欠片トークン』を集めます。その為には、誰よりも多くの『探索駒』を握って公開する事により、「回廊」を探索する権利を得ます。（２番目に多く公開したプレイヤーも探索の権利を得ます。） しかし、探索した「回廊」によってはマイナス点である「魔女の穢れ」を引き取る必要があります。それらを避けながら沢山の「回廊」を探索して『魂の欠片トークン』を集めましょう。集めた『魂の欠片トークン』によって『神託カード』を達成し、より多くの得点を獲得して「迷宮」を脱出しましょう
boardgame.boardgameartist: Gekidan Inu Curry (劇団イヌカレー)

boardgame.name: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine – GeekUp 1st Player Mini
boardgame.description: Do you feel your time as commander calls for a bit more authority? Start your mission in style with this 50mm tall figurine based on the artwork from the game The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine. This commander token is based on the artwork found on the "7" card, with the astronaut flashing the Vulcan salute as they trek across a rocky terrain.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine

boardgame.name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Babbey & Kux
boardgame.description:
An epic crossover for all backers in the Kickstarter campaign.

Kuxcoatl by artist Tom Babbey from Dragons of the Red Moon has been recreated in the style of Dodos Riding Dinos. This expansion contains a plastic miniature, a wooden meeple and their Dino Rider card.

boardgame.name: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine – GeekUp Game Bit Set
boardgame.description:
If you are going to explore space, make sure to bring the best equipment! So upgrade your cardboard tokens from The Crew: The Quest For Planet Nine. Feature translucent black plastic embedded with silver glitter, to give the illusion of stars in space, each of these pieces features the original artwork from the game. In this set, you will receive:


10 Take tokens
5 Communication tokens
1 Distress token
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine

boardgame.name: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine – GeekUp Mini Deck and Drawbag
boardgame.description:
Missions are hard enough in The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine, so save some of those precious mental and physical resources between rounds and eliminate half of the shuffling! This set of 36 GeekUp bits replaces the entire mini task deck, and allows you to draw the tokens out of the bag instead of shuffling this second deck. Made from black transparent black embedded with silver glitter, these bits feel like little square of deep space themselves, encases within a microfiber drawbag featuring artwork from the game.


36 tiles to replace the mini-deck (1-9, in four different colors, with symbols in the corners)
A drawbag with artwork from the card backs to replace shuffling the cards of the minideck
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine

boardgame.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: GeekUp Box Set
boardgame.description:
Already love the GeekUp bits for Quacks? Maybe you are looking for a new way to display the ingredient books? Then organize your game to perfection with this storage box set for Quacks of Quedlinburg! Designed to store all of the ingredients for both the base game and the Herb Witches expansions, this eight-box set is color-coded for each ingredient, with a built-in book stand in the attached cover.

Features:


Eight (8), color-coded boxes that nest on top of each other, and roomy enough to fit bits for five players while still fitting inside the original box (without the insert)



Each box is sub-divided to create different compartments for different values, with a sloped front to make it easy to scoop cardboard or GeekUp ingredients out of the box



The attached cover turns into a bookstand when it is flipped open



The set includes clear, plastic sign covers if you would prefer to make your own signage for the tops of your boxes


NOTE: GeekUp bits from the product images are not included in this box set.

Dimensions:


3-Compartment Box (red, yellow, green, and blue) = 90mm wide x 65mm deep x 39mm tall



2-Compartment Box (orange) = 80mm wide x 65mm deep x 39mm tall



1-Compartment Box (clear, black, and purple) = 71mm wide x 65mm deep x 35mm deep
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Quacks of Quedlinburg
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches

boardgame.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: GeekUp Bit Set – White Chip Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
Are you addicted to our GeekUp bits for Quacks of Quedlinburg? If so, you might want a few extra white chips to keep around in case you lose a few. This booster pack contains the amount of White Bombs you would find in the Witches' Expansion to add a fifth player:


6, one-value white bombs
3, two-value white bombs
2, three-value white bombs
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Quacks of Quedlinburg
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches

boardgame.name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Mecha Chicken Dinosaur
boardgame.description:
Chicken Nicholas joins the race with this mechanical dino. "Mecha Chicken Dimetrodon" is a crossover guest for Dodos riding Dinos and will be a machine that players can build in War for Chicken Island.we

This Expansion includes:
"Oby & The JJJ's" card as a Leader in War for Chicken Island.
Krakatoa & Cannons card as a runner for the Dodo Eggthrone in Dodos riding Dinos.
Mecha Chicken Dimetrodon miniature, compatible with 2 cards for both games, DrD and WFCI.

boardgame.name: Großes Mäuserennen durchs Labyrinth
boardgame.description: The Players start at the upper right and the lower left corner of the maze und take turns to move their mouse one space per turn. The first player to reach the center of the maze wins the game.

boardgame.name: Mars Escape
boardgame.description:
Your ship has just crash landed on Mars and the aliens have run off with the parts. Collect gear and weapons as you hunt down the aliens and retrieve your parts to repair your ship. However, you are not the only one and there are only enough parts for one astronaut to make it home. .

Mars Escape is fun backstabbing game in which players have to sabotage each other and eliminate aliens in order to win the game. You are equipped with weapons and items to take down aliens, but at the same time stopping your friends from collecting all the ship parts to make it back home. The first player to collect 4 ship parts (exterminate enough aliens) will be able to fly home to safety while leaving their friends to their fate at the hands or tentacles of aliens.

Mars Escape contains a 64 card deck which includes 11 aliens, 29 weapons, 24 items, and 1 rule book.

boardgame.name: The Towers of the Black Prince (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
Édouard Plantagenêt, better known as the Black Prince (1330-1376), was the eldest son of Edward III of England and Philippa of Hainaut. The origin of his nickname is uncertain. Some associate it with the colour of his armour; others refer to his reputation for brutality on the battlefield.

The Black Prince's "ride" in 1355 was a devastating raid. In Carcassonne, the upper town (city) remains untouched, but the lower town disappears in flames. In Narbonne, the suburbs, devoid of defences, were destroyed. Retracing his steps, Édouard took the Chemin de Gascogne, set fire to Miremont, destroyed Carbonne, Gimont and returned to his Bordeaux lands without difficulty.

Here, the Black Prince's army is represented by a wooden black tower figure (a black chess rook). The black tower will move around the playing area like the dragon (see Expansion 3 - The Princess & the Dragon), destroying any towers it encounters. It will capture all the followers placed on them.

Towers cannot capture any follower placed on the same tile as the black tower. The black tower cannot be removed from the game even by the dragon.

boardgame.name: Incohearent: Fresh Phrases Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: Our addicting guess-the-gibberish game just had a baby, and it’s the Incohearent Fresh Phrases Expansion pack. With 180 new gibberish cards to be added to the Incohearent Core game, hilarious game nights are guaranteed. A rotating judge holds a card up so that only they can see the answer, but everyone else sees the Incohearent phrase. Everyone else reads the front of the card aloud. Whoever decodes the phrase first wins the card.

boardgame.name: Spray-Spiel
boardgame.description:
There are 4 large and 12 small cards, that allow 3 different kinds of play:

- Each player gets a large card. The small cards lie bottom up on the table. The players take turns turning up a card. If the card belongs to the player's large card, he keeps it. Otherwise the card is returned to the table. The first player to get all 3 small cards belonging to his large card wins the game.

- Trump game: A player calls a trump card, f.i. "living room". Now the other players add a fitting card. The last player who is able to do this, collects the played cards and call a new trump card. The player who collects the most card wins the game. This game is played only with the small cards.

- Terzett game: All small cards are dialed among the players, who take turns to draw cards from one another to collect trios. Each player gets a large card to act as a wild card. The player with the most trios wins.

The pictures on the cards illustrate the correct use of aerosol sprays.

boardgame.name: デコニファ (Deconifer)
boardgame.description:
デコニファ (Deconifer) is a co-operative dexterity game of stacking from Japan. The playing area is a large wooden board showing a fir tree with ribbons, which stands propped up at an angle (much like a stepladder). Players take turns placing toys and gifts on the tree, starting from the bottom and working up.

There are some horizontal lines across sections of the tree. If a gift is placed so that it crosses a line, decorative balls and ribbons can also be hung on the tree. The game ends when a placed object falls from the tree.

At the end of the game, players can work out a score and see how well they did in decorating the tree. If they are careful, they will complete decorating the tree with a Santa and a golden star at the top.

The designer has specialised in highly ornate games made using woodburning techniques. The game features a large number of intricately designed, hand-made pieces, brightly coloured to produce a highly attractive design. As a result, only a few copies are made, and sell for a high price (approx $400).
user summary

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Companion Books
boardgame.description:
What is a Companion Book?

The Companion Books are the same as the Module Rules and Scenario booklets that are available in our games, with the exception we included most of the charts and tables that come within that game.  So why release the Companion book?  The Companion Books were designed for those gamers who are playing virtually and did not want to purchase the entire game just for the scenarios and tables to play via Vassal or Tabletop Simulator.  So to be clear the Companion Books are NOT complete games but contain everything a player will need to play via Vassal or Tabletop Simulator.  Players who prefer to play virtually can do so without the need to own the board (boxed) edition of the game.  The Companion Books can be used by players playing digitally via our  Digital DLC editions via Steam for their Macs or Windows computers.

So if you own or purchase the board games you don't need to purchase the Companion Books.  Some board game owners prefer them since they are spiral bound and will lay flat on the table and any typos or known errors found since the printing of the original edition of the board game has been updated.  The Companion books can be used with any game printing or game rule edition.

If you are looking for opponents on either Vassal or Tabletop Simulator can use our Discord server.

Please Note:  This is not a complete product and requires the use of the free modules via Vassal or Tabletop Simulator or the Digital DLC modules available via Steam.  The Companion books can also be used with the Tabletop Boardgame as well.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Day of Heroes
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes Against the Red Star
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes in Defiance
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of Normandy
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of North Africa
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Bitter Harvest
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Falklands
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Motherland
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Nam
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Pacific

Nations at War: Stalin's Triumph

boardgame.boardgameaccessory: World At War 85: Storming the Gap

boardgame.name: Galaxy Junkers
boardgame.description:
Galaxy Junkers is a 2 to 5 player sci-fi strategy game. With excellent replay value, this innovative game is fun for the whole family! Add a new swashbuckling spaceship adventure to your board game collection, and begin your quest to see who can survive the dangers of deep space.

You are galaxy junkers searching for valuable space artifacts from the ruins of an ancient space station. Unfortunately, the wormhole portal collapses, and your ship's engines and power core are severely damaged. You are stranded in deep space. You must salvage the ancient space cubes, power crystals, and power core and use them to escape. Beware: other galaxy junkers are right behind.

Objective: To win, collect the space cubes and power core indicated on your Ship Diagnostic card, and be the first player to reach the center of the wormhole. You may also win by destroying all opposing ships.

Play Time: The play time varies depending on the number of players.

3 Players: 30 minutes, 4 Players: 60-90 minutes, 5 Players: 90-120 minutes

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Death Violent Mountain
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Death Violent Mountain is a pamphlet sized quest suitable for any Fantasy ttrpg system. Drop it into your hex crawl, use it as a one off, or use it as part of a larger campaign.

Adventurers end up along the road near the young town of Cragwhisper. They can investigate the dangers along the road and in turn, discover the plot that brought the danger there in the first place. They become faced with choices to determine the fate of the village, save it or let the people of the mountain forest claim the townsfolk's lives so that all that will remain is the remnants of a town that could never be.

boardgame.name: Press Your Luck Board Game
boardgame.description:
Now you can play PRESS YOUR LUCK, the classic TV show, at home with your friends and family. Unfold the scoreboard, write your names, ask each other questions from the cards plus download the free Press Your Luck Appcessory to play the Electronic Big Board! But look out for those nasty Whammies. And speaking of Whammies, this edition includes a fantastic, collectable Plush Whammy!

The game lasts 3 rounds (2 for short game, 4 for long game). Each round consists of the host reading four question cards to the players. You will collect three spins if you answer the question correctly and are the first to lay down the answer card. If you lay down the correct answer card and are not first, you still get one spin. Zero spins for the wrong answer. After the question round, you get to play the Big Board and spend your spins. At any time, you can pass your spins to the next player and make them press their luck!

The winner is whoever survives the Whammys and makes the most money.

boardgame.name: BONC!
boardgame.description:
BONC! is The Battle Royale Of Card Games, it is a fun, intense, and strategic card game for kids and adults alike.

All players start with 5 lives each. Take turns playing one card face-up on the discard pile.

Try to BONC! the player right before you by matching the number of the card they played.
Or get fancy & use wild cards for special attacks, protection, & healing.

If you lose all your lives, you’re out of the game. The last one standing wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Moonrakers: Metal Ship Minis
boardgame.description:
Replicas of the PVC ship tokens that ship with every game, but cast in zinc alloy for that heavy token feel.

-- From the Publishers Website
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Moonrakers

boardgame.name: Anabid!: Bid, Spell, and Steal
boardgame.description:
In Anabid!, players compete to outspell, outbid and outwit their opponents to achieve the highest score.

After the custom 6- and 8-sided lettered dice are rolled, the first player states a word length and bids how many words that long they think they can spell. Each subsequent bid must increase the number of words or the word length.

Each player has a scant few seconds to make a bid and each bid is an opportunity to drive the next player to unwisely overbid -- a core strategy. The top bidder has a minute to fulfil his bid.

Words with greater lengths garner higher scores. To counter Aunt Edna's dictionary memorization, however, the game includes a clever mechanism that enables a would-be thief to steal the bid score! After each player has rolled three times (with the middle round in reverse order), the player with the highest score wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Card Game is a communal card game where the rules are only limited to the submission requirements. The end goal of the game is defined entirely by the players and the cards they decide to play as the game progresses.

A Player is/has: 1 Deck, a 4 card starting hand, and a zone to play cards. The cards tell the players everything else, and players must fill in the blanks.

This game requires you to play it before there is a clear end state, but as long as you follow the instructions of the cards, you will reach it. ~10% of cards contain win and loss scenarios. Normal gameplay revolves around setting up a zone in anticipation for a way to win, and all actions are done with the cards.

Players draw 1 card per turn, and play cards from their hand. [Places] are played in the player's respective zones, as are [People] and [Things]. [Things That Happen] are played, and then discarded.

1. Each card has a NAME.
2. Each card has a TYPE (Person, Place, Thing, or Thing That Happens).

Cards can have any optional keywords alongside their name and type. Common examples include:
Hand, Deck, Zone, Space, Discard, HP, Damage, Can't, Point, Win, Lose, Friend, Draw, Move, Tie, Counter, Opponent, Turn, Player, You, Look, Stack, Game, Card, Flip, Effect, Gain, Choose, Facedown, Drift or any others you may think of.

Percentages of each card type are constantly changing with every submission and print run.

This is a collectable card game. All proxies and bootlegs of official "Card Game" cards are legally sanctioned and considered "genuine" cards for casual or constructed play. This includes cards that are altered in terms of effects, art, printing quality, or physical alterations and damage.

boardgame.name: Here to Slay: Fierce Panguardian Promo Card
boardgame.description:
"At the beginning of your turn, you may switch The Fierce Panguardian between Guardian and Fighter.
Each time you CHALLENGE another player's card, that player cannot play Modifier cards until the end of the turn." - Card Text

listing.notes:
Especially for collectors of HERE TO SLAY
HERE TO SLAY- The Fierce Panguardian- Convention Exclusive Card
This is the ultra rare exclusive card ‘’The Fierce Panguardian’’ that was never sold in stores. The only chance to get it was at a Teeturtle sponsored convention.
The card came wrapped at the convention, and as an extra layer of protection, I put it into a tarot-sized, card sleeve (black or white colored) immediately after receiving it. Other than that, the card has never been touched or played with. The condition of the card is NEW and IMPECCABLE.
Since unfortunately there are a lot of fake products here on eBay, I guarantee hereby the authenticity of the product, as I was an attendant at the Teeturtle sponsored event, MegaCon 2022 in Orlando, Florida that took place from May 19th-22nd. I am a collector myself and therefore only own original products that I bought and imported directly. You’ll get here an AUTHENTIC product.

boardgame.name: Smeghead and the Dares
boardgame.description:
Are You Ready to Dare: Smeghead card game is here to transform every moment of boredom into an entertaining party game that you won’t get tired of! This game is the ideal combination of skill and luck, where the only purpose is to have fun while testing your courage with silly or brave challenges.

Endless Hours of Fun: You don’t need to be a mastermind to play this party game for kids, as the only requirement is to be open to challenges and tons of fun. Our game is based on silly, hilarious, or bold dares, perfect to break the monotony and share endless moments of fun and laughter with your friends.

For All the Family: If you are older than 14 and have a good sense of humor and passion for life, this card game is perfect for you! Gather your family, friends, or colleagues outside work and embark on an unforgettable experience full of tension, laughter, competition, and see if you are up to the challenge.

Party Ice Breaker: Whether you plan to meet with your friends on a night out or want to change the atmosphere in your house, the Smeghead adult card games are definitely the right choice. They are perfect for birthday parties, anniversaries, family reunions, trips, holidays, or other events.

Easy to Play: The Smeghead family card game contains 4 types of cards and an easy-to-read guide, which makes this game extremely easy to play. Daring, uneasy, and super fun, this game will get you hooked from the first hand, dragging you into endless rounds of fun and dares.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Agon - dodatkowe wyspy
boardgame.description:
From publisher's blurb:
W tym suplemencie do gry AGON, autorstwa Andrzeja Stója, znajdziecie osiem zupełnie nowych wysp. Każda z nich oferuje inne wyzwania – Herosi mierzą się z potworami, olbrzymami, a nawet bogami i tytanami. Dodatek kładzie mocniejszy nacisk na wojnę, która była przyczyną rozpoczęcia wyprawy Herosów. Bogowie wpływają na los innych śmiertelników, manipulując nimi tak samo, jak Herosami. Przeszłość wpływa na teraźniejszość.

boardgame.name: Ulice śmierci
boardgame.description:
Ulice śmierci: Surwiwalowa gra o zombie to polska gra fabularna opowiadająca o zmaganiach ocalałych w świecie opanowanym przez hordy zombie! Rozgrywka nastawiona jest na surwiwal, eksplorację i współpracę.

Minęły niecałe dwa lata, od kiedy epi­demia spustoszyła cały kraj. Zara­żeni wirusem ludzie umierają lub zmieniają się w bezmózgie stworzenia, zombie. Te potwory nazywane zdechlakami potrafią zarazić straszliwym wirusem zdrowych ludzi: w większości przypadków ugryzienie zabija lub zmienia nieszczęśnika w zombie.

Prąd i ogrzewanie w obecnych czasach są luksusem. Dostęp do czystej wody i żywności jest bardzo ograniczony. Niedostępność paliwa i innych materiałów napędowych powoduje, że auta stoją porzucone na poboczach. Nigdzie nie można na dłużej zagrzać miejsca, całkowicie bezpieczne schronienia nie istnieją. By przetrwać, należy ciągle się przemieszczać.

Gracze wcielają się w ocalałych, ludzi, którym zwyczajnie się poszczęściło. Przeżyli, unikając śmiercionośnego wi­rusa i hord zombie. Niektórzy odpo­wiednio wcześniej przewidzieli apoka­lipsę i przygotowali się na najgorsze. Zebrani w niewielką grupę starają się przeżyć kolejny dzień: omijają hordy zombie, szukają bezpiecznego schronie­nia na noc, pożywienia i starają się wy­trzymać psychicznie to, co spotkało cały świat.

boardgame.name: Wörterlegen-Lotto
boardgame.description:
First, 15 picture cards are distributed according to the lotto rules (3 picture cards per tray). Then letter cards for the 4-letter words are called out. Since the letters are needed several times, speed is also important here in order to be the first to fill the board. Whoever manages to do this wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Collector's Box
boardgame.description: This Collector's Box is designed to fit Viscounts, Gates of Gold, Keeper of Keys, and all additional content, such as promos and metal coins. And yes, it fits sleeved cards. The box is the same size as the Collector's Boxes for Raiders of the North Sea and Paladins of the West Kingdom (295x295x69mm).
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Viscounts of the West Kingdom
Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Crossover Promo Pack
Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Gates of Gold
Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Keeper of Keys

boardgame.name: Woodcraft
boardgame.description:
In Woodcraft, you play as elves running competing workshops in the woods, with you gathering wood and crafting goods for your customers. Along the way, you hire helpers, improve your workshop, and buy different types of wood and other tools to create the best workshop you can.

During the game, players complete their projects with wood (dice) that can be cut down to size, glued back together, and adjusted using dice manipulation to be as efficient as possible with their resources.

Whoever builds the best, most successful workshop wins.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

boardgame.name: Selfish: Star Wars Edition
boardgame.description:
Selfishness is a helpful trait in Disney Star Wars Selfish, as you search the galaxy for rebel scum aboard the Millennium Falcon!

In order to win, you must preserve your fuel supply, upgrade your ship, and fight your way through space to reach the rebels first.

Attack other players to move through space towards your target, but don't let others disable you on your journey, you must protect yourself!

If you do run out of fuel, or have no upgrades on your ship, your ship is broken down, you're stranded, and you're out of the game.

But, if you reach the Millennium Falcon first, then you capture the Rebels and win. Everyone else loses the game!

—description from the publisher

Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Afrika macht Schule
boardgame.description:
A cooperative game about the rural school situation in Africa. 36 cards are laid out face down in a 6x6 grid.
Players roll the dice and move one of 3 pieces across the grid, but may not jump over gaps. The card you leave is revealed.
On 5 cards there are obstacles to learning (e.g. lack of school fees), which have to be removed immediately after uncovering in order to win the game. To remove a learning obstacle, an already uncovered photo pair must be removed from the grid. 4 turtle cards (recognizable on the back) help when it gets tough on the playing field. 1 monkey card causes trouble and all cards are unrevealed.

—user summary

boardgame.name: A Billion Suns: Warzone
boardgame.description:
Warzone is the first new contract set for A Billion Suns. It allows players to use A Billion Suns to tell brutal stories of military might and system-shaking clashes of far-future weaponry.

A Billion Suns, played with the Core Systems contract set provided in the rulebook, is a game of cleverly and frugally assigning resources, telling stories of industrial espionage and resource capture.

The Warzone contract set changes the feel of A Billion Suns considerably. The Warzone contract set allows players to play an all-out war between their two corporations. The stories these new contracts tell are different, and you’ll find a host of new tactical questions to wrestle with.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Billion Suns: Interstellar Fleet Battles

boardgame.name: Hurricane Deathbot
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For as long as anyone can remember, a great swirling hurricane has raged unabated in the middle of the open ocean, and at its center, a lonely metal island. But now, for reasons unknown, the hurricane is rapidly approaching the coast, threatening the lives of everyone in its path. This adventure is designed for 4 PCs of level 9.

Classic 5 room dungeon design meets the terse fit of two-page layout in this one-shot by Jesse Brown.

boardgame.name: The Coven
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Waterborough, a sleepy seaside village set atop a high, rocky bluff is taken by surprise when its inhabitants succumb to a mysterious ailment that drives its victims to jump off the cliff into the watery depths below. When diseased villagers are prevented from jumping, they dry up and crumble into dust before everyone’s unbelieving eyes. What is this disease and how can it be cured or if this is a punishment from the sea god, how can Innak be appeased?

The Coven is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 5th-level characters or higher. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Warped
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warped is a simple Q-Encounter to be dropped during a rest at one of the currier stations found throughout the Kingdom of Castiel. During the night, a gate from the Shadow Realm awakens after goblins stumble upon an artifact, opening a door to the Material Plane. With their inability to stabilize the gate, a few daring long-toothed goblins step through only to discover the gate is distorted, a passage that warps anything that passes through.

Warped is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 2nd-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: GM Starter Pack
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Essentials: GM Starter Pack is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Essentials: GM Starter Pack contains ten 30x30 battlemaps. The set contains ten locations that are frequently used and will provide you with a core set of maps for your games.

Cave
City Streets (Exterior Only)
Forest Clearing
Crypt
Dungeon
Evil Temple
Rural Inn/Tavern
Rural Road
Rural Ruins
Village (exterior only)

boardgame.name: Labyrinth Hill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Merchants fleeing a small town let you know that a community is under duress ahead. The adventuring biz has been somewhat lackluster so now is your chance to shine! In the shadow of Labyrinth Hill you move down the road!

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for seven, second level adventurers.

boardgame.name: Grand Slam Tennis
boardgame.description:
Sports simulation that allows realistic Tournament Play and Season Play in a reasonable time scale, while still giving ALL the features that come in to effect during ATP / WTA Tennis seasons. You can play Singles or Doubles, Seasons, Tournaments, on-off matches. World Team Tennis, Davis Cup, Federation Cup, or Hopman Cup matches or Tournaments or any other Contests you wish.

The game comes with the options of playing a set-by-set mode, game-by-game mode or instant match results mode where the outcome is determined by the roll of a few dice. Men and women players are rated for each year to give realistic scores but still with the possibility of generating shock results.

The first Sportsreplays set release was the Australian Open 2012 Edition including updated ratings as at January 30th 2012.

boardgame.name: Hazard: Tsunami
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sunny day at the beach: warm water, endless blue sky, boundless waves. Suddenly, the ocean seems to flee from the land, pulling back farther out than any low tide. Then it appears out on the horizon: a dark line that seems to thicken as it comes closer. Soon it resolves into a horrible wall of water 7 meters high, racing at unfathomable speed toward suddenly-panicked onlookers. But running is useless…by the time they saw it, it was already too late.

A tsunami (from the Japanese meaning “harbor wave”) is a series of giant waves caused by an event that suddenly displaces a large-scale amount of water. Also informally called“tidal waves” (a misleading term, since they have nothing to do with tides), tsunamis can occur in any substantial body of water, including inland seas, large lakes, bays, sounds, and harbors. They differ from normal wind-generated waves in their genesis and structure.

Spawned by anything that displaces a lot of water at once, tsunamis can race across an ocean with incredible speed, leaving little trace of their passing to ship crews. But upon reaching the shore, they become an unstoppable wall of death and destruction. Few land-dwelling creatures can withstand the wrath of the very ocean turned against them.

Hazard: Tsunami! allows the Referee to challenge hir Players with this unstoppable, unpredictable, invulnerable enemy. This short file is packed with a short discussion of how tsunamis form, their characteristics, and game stats.

Hazard: Tsunami! Don’t get swept away.

boardgame.name: Hazard: Matterslip!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A lovely day out skiing and snowboarding with friends, warmly dressed against the biting cold and with eyes shaded against the blinding white snow. Just as someone suggests returning to the chalet for hot cocoa and relaxation, they hear a loud whump! from farther up the mountain, followed by a deafening roar. Fun turns to terror as the skiiers try to outrun the monster wall of white bearing down on them. If they can only reach that pine forest in time…

“Matterslip” is an umbrella term used to describe a quickly-moving surge of material (including snow, rocks, earth, or mud) usually from a higher elevation to a lower one. The most stereotypical variant is an avalanche, a matterslip composed mainly of snow. Matterslips are also known (depending on composition) as landslides, rockslides, and mudslides.

Matterslips are among the most common of natural hazards. All that’s needed are some form of solid matter, a slope of 30°-45°, and gravity. Triggers can be anything that provides enough shock or resonance to cause a mechanical failure of the unsupported material. Contrary to popular belief, matterslips cannot be caused by loud sounds; the trigger must be mechanical in nature.

Hazard: Matterslip! allows the Referee to challenge hir Players with this unstoppable, unpredictable, invulnerable enemy. This short file is packed with a short discussion of how matterslips form, their characteristics, game stats, and their many variants.

Hazard: Matterslip! That climb just got a lot harder.

boardgame.name: Jane's Deception (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doctor Elias Poole was a freelance researcher. He’d had a few setbacks, mostly due to the lingering economic effects of the Collapse and the ongoing social strife in the city, but lately things had been looking up. He’d made a series of minor advances that gave others a framework to build upon; and he’d met Jane, a beautiful young woman.

But lately, he had started to reflect on the ramifications of his work. Doc had begun to focus less on whether science could, and more on whether science should. He tried discussing the subject with Jane, who would just give him a blank stare, tell him not to worry about it, and start doing those things she knew always…distracted him.

But Doc had noticed odd behavior in Jane. Her irritability whenever he started having pangs of regret. The nights she went to the store "just for a minute" and stayed gone for several hours. The extra mileage logged on his car. Still, she swore she wasn’t cheating, and kept pleasuring him i the same as she always did.

This morning: Jane finally blew up at Doc, saying he should just keep at his work and not worry about what comes after. That's when he finally put his foot down; he would stop work on his research altogether.

She really didn't like hearing that...

Jane’s Deception is a cyberpunk adventure for New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America, which uses the Cepheus Engine (CE), Cepheus Deluxe (CD), and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules. The main plot concerns the death of an acquaintance, the theft of his scientific data, and the team’s efforts to prevent its delivery to the highest bidder.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: White Dragon Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #51: White Dragon Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the white dragon lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: RPG Review (Issues 51 & 52 - Jul/Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a double issue on "Housing, Food, and Clothing" and includes a massive Eclipse Phase campaign story, Ettins & Chickens for D&D5e, City and Food RPG Reviews, Pre-Generated Foodie Characters, Blood Sucking Blades for RuneQuest, "Beneath" short story, and much more!

boardgame.name: A.D.E.L.E.: Kickstarter Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
Exclusive mini expansion for backers of the game during the Kickstarter campaign.
This expansion includes 2 new anomalies for ADELE and 4 new objects (2 copies of each) to make your game a little more different.

The new anomalies: Simply add these new tiles to the ones already in the game; just keep in mind they are not suitable for game modes where ADELE plays as an automaton.

Maintenance Robot and Surprise Attack

The new objects:

Computer Virus, Portable Charger, PDA, Portable EMP:

You may just add the new objects to the common pool of objects but there is a risk that some vital objects will become too scarce, like the batteries or the space suits. So it is recommended removing some existing objects when using the new ones as follows:

Computer Virus - remove 1 battery and 1 Stimulants
PDA - remove 1 flashlight and 1 space suit
Portable charger - remove 1 flashlight and 1 pieces
Portable EMP - remove 1 teddy and 1 first aid kit
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Archivist's Bounty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brand New Character Options for 5th Edition

Binding the 25 PDF articles released by TBM Games in 2021 into a single volume, Archivist's Bounty brings more than 20 new subclasses to world's most popular RPG, ranging from exiled noble barbarians to adaptive wizards who can deconstruct magic at its most fundamental principles, along with two ancient artifacts, a selection of character feats, chronomantic spells, and monsters for underwater adventuring!

This supplement includes:

21 subclasses for all of the core Fifth Edition classes
A new background for building characters with fey origins
Feats to enhance existing characters
Spells to add new variety to spellcasting characters
Two new artifacts, the Body of the Armored Tyrant and the *Death Shroud of the First Paladin
3 new aquatic monsters

boardgame.name: Explosive Runes (Issue 31 - Winter 2021)
boardgame.description:
Explosive Runes
Issue 31
Winter 2021
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings Roleplaying Game (5th Edition)

boardgame.name: Rajska Laguna
boardgame.description:
From the author's note:

Szanowna Mistrzyni, Drogi Mistrzu Gry!
Poniższy scenariusz rozgrywa się w realiach Pacyficznego Teatru Działań Wojennych, podczas
II Wojny Światowej. Nie szukałbym w nim jednak realizmu historycznego, ponieważ cała
ta opowieść doprawiona jest też dużą ilością horroru wprost z kart opowiadań Howarda
Philipsa Lovecrafta.
System
Scenariusz pisałem z myślą o Weird War II- jednym z settingów Savage Worlds.
Ponieważ otrzemy się nieco o wymyśloną przez Lovecrafta mitologię, znajomość kilku
głównych jego tekstów będzie przydatna. Zresztą Wielki Cthulhu stał się częścią popkultury,
więc wiedza jak wygląda, to już nie ezoteryka. Jeśli jesteś zupełnym nowicjuszem w dziedzinie
Lovecraftowej kosmologii nie martw się - jest pomocna, ale da się poprowadzić Rajską Lagunę
i bez niej. Pamiętaj – to nie jest scenariusz do Zewu – tutaj też trochę straszymy, ale
i kładziemy nacisk na akcję, a bohaterowie mogą poczęstować gigantycznego potwora bombą
głębinową.

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 264 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
GTM: Game Trade Magazine
Issue No. 264
February

Dice Realms

boardgame.name: The Last Gig
boardgame.description:
The Last Gig is a board game that simulates your band life on the road: unforgettable concerts and poor food, merch to sell after each Live, and records to be recorded in the studio. But mostly many, many, MANY kilometers to travel with your partners!

There is only one way to beat your opponents: get on stage!

On your turn, roll the dice, stop in the tour spaces, play in awesome venues, do live sessions to get (or lose) Tour Points, spin the Rock Wheel to or buy new Merch cards that you can sell at your next Live session.

Race around, gather as much Tour Points as possible, and be the first to finish the game with your Last Gig!

boardgame.name: The Merchant's Plea
Side Quest Adventures #1: The Merchant's Plea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Merchant's Plea is a one-shot advneture meant for 2-4 characters of level 3-4. This adventure is relatively system and setting neutral, and thus can be slipped into your games with minimal preparation, but would probably fit best in a Pathfinder or 5e system.

boardgame.name: Side Quest Adventures #2: The Dunnvale Bounty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dunnvale Bounty is a lower-level adventure for 3-4 characters of 4th or 5th level and was designed to work with either PF1e or 5e.

boardgame.name: Side Quest Adventures #3: Balancing the Scales
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Balancing the Scales is a mid-level adventure for four 9-10th level characters and is written to be compatible with both the Pathfinder 1st Edition and Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition systems.

boardgame.name: Rifts: Atlantis Map
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color 17” x 11” poster map depicts Atlantis long after the Rifts tore the world asunder and returned the continent to Earth with apocalyptic fury, where it was colonized by the monstrous Splugorth. All the key locations of the continent are noted in beautiful detail and epic scale, giving Game Masters and players alike a full sense of the world they’re exploring and trying to save.

boardgame.name: Rifts Map Pack 1: Ruined City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Map Pack 1: Ruined City features an apocalyptic urban area destroyed by the Great Cataclysm on one side, and a ramshackle settlement on the other—perfect for use in any region of Rifts® Earth.

boardgame.name: Rifts Map Pack 2: Atlantis Pyramid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Map Pack 2: Atlantis Pyramid features a magic stone pyramid and its outer courtyard on one side, with the pyramid’s interior on the other side.

boardgame.name: Seven of Seven: Pantheon of the Chain - Reforged
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The realms and world that we play in are often filled with any number of divine beings, figures of untold power, or even devilish entities with dark desires. There are some adventures that require the strength of these figures to use their magic, heal their allies, or escape dangers. At times one might find themselves to be tested by these individuals, find themselves under trial from a zealous king, or even discover that the dungeon they are in was once a temple to an ancient deity.

Now GM’s and Players alike can:

The nature of each deity in the form of personality, depiction, and interactions
Might boons and banes from the divine with a simple to use d4 table for each.
The nature of each deity in the form of personality, depiction, and interactions.
Celebrations revolving around deities in the form of holidays, feasts, and festivals.
200+ divine artifacts that have been touched by the Gods.


Myths and lore to make the deities more mysterious and unique.

Divine organizations that worship or follow each deity.


In this 187-page book that reforged the pantheon of Seven of Seven the reader will find a brand-new pantheon of deities for use in any fantasy role-playing game! Inside, there are 56 reforged Gods & Goddesses that you can use however you need in your game. You can make them new gods, ancient gods, or perhaps powerful individuals whose affiliation remains a mysterious secret in your realm.

boardgame.name: Cubitos: GeekyGameyGadgets Insert/Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Cubitos the board game.

This custom MDF insert makes playing Cubitos a breeze! Game setup takes no time at all. Dice tray also serve as card holders so you can see the abilities from across the table. Ramped tray edges make it easy to remove components. Everything fits quickly and conveniently back in the box.

Resource trays include customized engravings depicting their contents, so it's easy to see what goes where. Store your game however you want and everything stays organized -- horizontally, vertically even upside-down.

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues. Does not include the game itself.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Cubitos

boardgame.name: Remorhaz Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #52: Remorhaz Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the orc caves in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Rhino 5
boardgame.description:
Rhino 5 is a cooperative card-based crisis management board game for 2-4 players.

Players form the crew of an old mining spacecraft, caught in a deadly meteor storm after an immense catastrophe that has engulfed the solar system. Play cards and use special skills, as you work together to repair damage to your ship. All while simultaneously trying to avoid incoming meteors, which will continue hitting the ship until you reach and complete a hidden objective.

Play isolated scenarios, or take part in a solar-system spanning campaign to save the people of Earth and discover what caused the catastrophe in the first place.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Illuminated Warrior
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Reshina grew up in the fighting pits of the Southern Cities. But there was always more to her life than fighting. From an early age, she dreamt of an ancient, foreign temple, high up on a mountaintop. Asleep, but strangely awake, she walked its grounds and knelt before its idols. Over time, the dreams grew stronger, until she was convinced her visions showed her a place not in some astral plane, but here on Earth. Its call was a siren song to her. Reshina knew she must go to it.

She sold her life’s story to a publisher. Confessions of a Teenage Pit Fighter sold well, especially after the publisher hired another writer to add salacious scenes of sexual debauchery to the so-called “unexpurgated” version. But Reshina didn’t care. Why should it matter if her book made others rich? All she wanted was enough coin to travel north into the mountains, and find this temple.

And she did, for it was no mere vision. It was real. Inside its walls, she met the Illuminated Masters and was initiated. Now part of their cult, she donned her cyclopean armour and left her old life behind. For the Masters have need of her services, and she is eager to see their vision of the future come to fruition at long last.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Wookiee Warriors Expansion
boardgame.description:
Add a formidable unit of powerful Wookiees to your Star Wars: Legion armies with the Wookiee Warriors Unit Expansion! This tall and commanding species boasts nearly unrivaled physical strength and ferocity, and now both the Galactic Republic and Rebel Alliance can make use of their formidable skills.

The Wookiee Warriors Unit Expansion puts six Wookiee Warrior miniatures that can be assembled and used in a variety of ways at your command, including as either a close-range unit carrying ryyk blades and Kashyyk pistols or a unit of Wookiee sharpshooters firing X1 Carbines. No matter how you assemble your miniatures, four upgrade cards invite you to field these units for both the Republic and Rebel factions. Additionally, a miniature representing a Wookiee Chieftain can enter the fight as a Republic commander and a fifth unit card and three command cards let them further influence your strategy. Finally, eight upgrade cards invite you to customize your units with Wookiees carrying an array of weaponry.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world is a bizarre place, especially that of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure, a massively popular and highly recommended manga (and anime) series. Due to the craziness of the fights, mind-busting strategies and “unique” style of the characters, Risus stands up as the system of choice for such an adventure. This document contains explanations for the strange powers used throughout the series, sample Clichés and many suggestions to truly make your adventure unique and bizarre. It also contains many iterations of the word “bizarre”, so be warned. Beware that this setting also makes use of shield-mates and double-pumping rules.

boardgame.name: Ruthless Conquest
boardgame.description:
This is a strategic war game that uses real-world effects to make for a realistic experience. In this game, the players could build businesses, collect taxes and use this money to build an army to conquer the world. Here, any alliances formed for battle can be broken and trust can end up being limited. The costs and taxes can change with business cycles and trades between players are allowed.

At the start, each player starts off with two countries. The game will be conducted in rounds. Each round a player can choose to do an action with their cards, trade or even start wars with their resources. The player that gets a clear majority (more than half) of the countries under their control wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
